skill.name: create-pr
skill.description: Generate commit message, PR title, and PR body for a pull request. Use when the user wants to create a PR, generate PR content, prepare a pull request, or fill a PR template from code changes.
skill.summary: Generate commit message, PR title, and PR body for a pull request. Use when the user wants to create...
skill.author: Cloud-Officer

security_audit.summary: All static findings evaluated as false positives. The skill uses legitimate git commands for pull request content generation. Shell command substitutions and file reads are hardcoded, controlled operations for a git-helper tool.

content.value_statement: Manually crafting commit messages and PR descriptions is time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill automatically generates professional commit messages, PR titles, and PR bodies by analyzing your code changes against the target branch.
actual_capabilities: Generates concise commit messages (max 80 characters) following conventional commit guidelines
Creates PR titles that summarize the overall purpose of changes
Fills PR body with structured summary, key changes list, and checklist items
Reads and populates existing PR templates from .github directory
Integrates JIRA ticket numbers from environment variables when available
limitations: Does not execute git commands itself - requires git tool access
Cannot verify that all mentioned files are actually modified
Does not create branches or push changes to remote
Relies on user to run linters and verify code quality before generating

use_cases.title: Streamlined Code Review Preparation
use_cases.description: Quickly generate professional PR content for code review. The skill creates clear summaries and checklists that help reviewers understand changes faster.

use_cases.title: Consistent Documentation Across Teams
use_cases.description: Maintain consistent PR documentation by using existing templates. The skill preserves all checkbox items and formatting from your team templates.

use_cases.title: JIRA Integration Workflow
use_cases.description: Automatically include JIRA ticket numbers in PR descriptions when the JIRA_TICKET environment variable is set. Connect code changes to tracking systems.

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the create-pr skill to generate commit message, PR title, and PR body for my current changes.
prompt_templates.scenario: Standard use case for any set of code changes

prompt_templates.title: After Running Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the linters to verify code quality, then use the create-pr skill to generate PR content for my changes.
prompt_templates.scenario: Ensuring code quality before PR creation

prompt_templates.title: Feature Branch to Main
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate PR content for merging my feature branch into the main branch. Include a detailed summary of all changes.

prompt_templates.title: Hotfix PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate urgent PR content for a hotfix. The commit message should start with 'Fix' and the PR body should highlight the critical nature of the fix.
prompt_templates.scenario: Emergency bug fix requiring quick deployment

output_examples.input: User runs create-pr skill after making changes to authentication module
output: Add user authentication flow with OAuth support
Add user authentication flow with OAuth support
This PR introduces OAuth authentication support for user login.
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

output_examples.input: User with JIRA_TICKET=PROJ-123 runs create-pr skill
output: Update database schema for user profiles
Update database schema for user profiles
This PR updates the database schema to support extended user profile information.

best_practices: Run the create-pr skill after verifying all changes are staged or committed
Review the generated content before pushing to ensure accuracy
Use the run-linters skill first to verify code quality
Customize the .github/pull_request_template.md for your team conventions
anti_patterns: Do not use the skill on uncommitted changes without first reviewing the diff
Do not skip the linter check - the skill explicitly references this
Do not modify the output section labels (COMMIT MESSAGE:, PR TITLE:, PR BODY:)
Do not generate PR content for code that has not been reviewed or tested

faq.question: Does the create-pr skill push changes to remote?
faq.answer: No. The skill only generates commit messages, PR titles, and PR body content. You must manually push your branch and create the PR on GitHub.

faq.question: Can I customize the output format?
faq.answer: The skill follows a fixed output format with section labels. You can customize the content within each section but not the overall structure.

faq.question: How does the skill handle PR templates?
faq.answer: The skill looks for .github/pull_request_template.md or .github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md and populates it. If no template exists, it generates a basic structure.

faq.question: What if my repository uses a different branch name for main?
faq.answer: The skill automatically detects the default branch using git symbolic-ref. If detection fails, it defaults to 'master' as a fallback.

faq.question: Does the skill check for sensitive data in commits?
faq.answer: No. The skill does not scan for secrets or sensitive information. Review your diffs manually before committing.

faq.question: How do I use JIRA ticket integration?
faq.answer: Set the JIRA_TICKET environment variable before running the skill. The value will be automatically inserted into the Jira Tickets section of the PR body.
